text: A Service of the Fifth Circuit Library System

text: - A valid, official photo I.D. is required -  “Valid and Official” means federal, state, or municipal I.D.
label: BODY

text: cards or licenses that contain a picture.  Photo I.D.’s such as ‘Sam’s Club’ cards  are not acceptable.
label: BODY

text: - No tape recording or video recording devices are permitted
label: BODY

text: - Guards do not have storage facilities to hold any items
label: BODY

text: - CELL PHONES are permitted, but must be OFF inside the courtrooms
label: HH2

text: - No weapons of any kind, including pocket knives and mace
label: BODY

text: - Handicapped Access available on Capdeville St., push buzzer, or call ahead: (504) 310-7791

text: Directions to the John Minor Wisdom Court of Appeals Building
label: HH3

text: The building at 600 Camp St. can be reached by taking Canal St. or Poydras St. southeast toward the
label: BODY

text: river and turning right onto either St. Charles Ave., or two blocks further right onto Magazine Street.
label: BODY

text: The building is directly across from Lafayette Square which is bordered by Maestri Place, St. Charles,
label: BODY

text: and Camp St.  The building itself is bordered by Camp St., Poydras St., Magazine St., and Capdeville St.
label: BODY

text: -  Take EXIT 235B toward Canal St. / Superdome
label: BODY

text: -  Stay straight to go onto S. Derbingny St.
label: BODY

text: -  Turn Right onto St. Charles Ave.
label: BODY

text: -  Turn Left onto S. Maestri Place
label: BODY

text: - Take I-10 East toward New Orleans
label: HH2

text: - Take Exit 234B on the left toward Poydras St. / Superdome
label: BODY

text: - Turn slight left onto Poydras St.
label: BODY

text: - Turn Right onto St. Charles Ave.
label: BODY

text: Parking near the Court of Appeals
label: HH3

text: There are practically no public meters on the four streets bordering the federal buildings: Poydras,
label: BODY

text: Camp, Magazine and Capdeville. There are public meters near the area, but they are hard to find and
label: BODY

text: expensive for long term - you’ll need lots of change!
label: BODY

text: The city quickly tows illegally parked cars;  you may not get a warning ticket. Impound-towing fees
label: BODY

text: are very expensive and it can take hours to retrieve your car. W e don’t want that to happen to you, so we
label: BODY

text: 650 Poydras at Camp (entrance on Camp St.)
label: BODY

text: 525-6911   7am -6pm $13 - Fills up early in the day
label: BODY

text: 408 Camp St.  (504) 558-0805   In early, out late: $8
label: BODY

text: Very close, but fills up early, and cars get blocked in.
label: BODY

text: Self-service lots on Magazine at Julia Street
label: HH3

text: Insert coins/bills into a slot on the honor system. These fill up early.
label: BODY

text: Poydras at Convention Center Blvd. Not very close, but easy in and out, reliable, covered, with security.
label: BODY

text: 5 blocks from courthouse, per hour rates, $10-$20 per day
label: BODY

text: 6  blocks from courthouse.  Not very close, but easy in and out, reliable, covered,
label: BODY

text: with security. Hourly rates, $10-$20 per day
label: BODY

text: Hotel Parking Near the Courthouse - Pricey
label: HH3

text: The building provides vending machines on the first floor back hallway.   There is also a federal
label: BODY

text: cafeteria located in the basement of the Hale Boggs Building adjacent to the Court of Appeals.  It is open
label: BODY

text: for breakfast and lunch, Mondays through Fridays. There are many great restaurants within blocks of
label: BODY

text: the courthouse.  One local favorite is Bon Ton Café at 401 Magazine St.  It is medium-priced and
label: BODY

text: The librarians keep copies of Gambit’s Annual Restaurant Guide.  Just ask!
label: BODY

text: Most hotels in New Orleans are sold out several months in advance of Mardi Gras, Jazzfest, the
label: BODY

text: French Quarter Festival, Essence Festival, and Sugar Bowl W eekend.   Premium rates apply during those
label: BODY

text: times.  Call the library for information on dates: (504) 310-7797.
label: BODY

text: Major Hotels within 5 - 10 blocks of the Court of Appeals
label: HH3

text: The Fifth Circuit Library System serves the federal judiciary and related agencies throughout
label: BODY

text: Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas.  The headquarters library in New Orleans also serves local attorneys
label: BODY

text: and the general public by providing a current legal research facility and personalized reference service by
label: BODY

text: - Library Internet site with links to opinions, publications, and research sites
label: BODY

text: - Links to Fifth Circuit Archives material via the Online Catalog
label: BODY

text: - Public Access Terminals providing access to legal research sites, Internet, Lexis and W estlaw
label: BODY

text: (using your own password) CD-Rom resources, and W ord Processing programs
label: BODY

text: - Photocopies and computer print-outs at 10¢ per page.   Printing to disks is free.
label: BODY

text: - State Statutes, current and superceded, for Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas
label: BODY

text: - Current biographies of Fifth Circuit judges
label: BODY

text: - Faxing documents upon request - published and unpublished Fifth Circuit decisions
label: BODY

text: and other brief documents can be faxed or emailed to you upon request
label: BODY

text: - Current national and local newspapers and magazines and a great lounge area
label: BODY

text: - Tours of building, when practicable, for individuals or groups.  Contact librarian
label: BODY

text: If you still have questions about your visit to the John Minor Wisdom Court of Appeals
label: BODY

text: Building, don’t hesitate to call Library Public Services at (504) 310-7797
label: BODY
